feed.title: SAP Community - PLM EAM/Plant Maintenance
feed.subtitle: PLM EAM/Plant Maintenance Q&A in SAP Community

entry.title: SAP PM, how to move release orders 1-2 months early
entry.content:
Hi All

I am a new user (5 months)

Our plant is shutting one line down early this year for annual maintenance.  How do I move / release +-2300 maintenance orders that are due in December to be available / released in October and November?

I tried IP10 and the only way I could find was by manually releasing and TECO each call manually but this will take forever.

Any help would be appreciated

entry.title: Business Function Activation for scope items 4HH 4HI has not delivered configuration
entry.content:
We are currently in a live PRIVATE S/4HANA environment, and for a new project we wish to use the scope items 4HH - Reactive Maintenance and 4HI - Proactive Maintenance.

Following the information from this link Required Enterprise Business Functions | SAP Help Portal we have activated the following Business Functions in our Dev environment.

LOG_EAM_CI_8
LOG_EAM_CI_9
LOG_EAM_CI_10
LOG_EAM_CI_11
LOG_EAM_CI_12
LOG_EAM_SIMPLICITY
LOG_EAM_SIMPLICITY_2
LOG_EAM_SIMPLICITY_3
LOG_EAM_SIMPLICITY_4
LOG_EAM_SIMPLICITY_5
LOG_EAM_SIMPLICITY_6
LOG_EAM_SIMPLICITY_7
LOG_EAM_SIMPLICITY_8
LOG_EAM_SIMPLICITY_9
LOG_EAM_SIMPLICITY_10
LOG_EAM_SIMPLICITY_11
LOG_EAM_SIMPLICITY_12
LOG_EAM_IME_1

Unfortunately no configuration has been loaded as a result of this activation, although I appreciate it might be my misunderstanding of how it should work. For example Maintenance Order YA01 does not exist in the system.

Is there something we are missing here? Please can you advise us if there is anything else we need to do? We have not activated any of the "previous" business functions, so not sure whether this needs to be done although there is no dependency on the items we have activated.

Many thanks, Adrian

entry.title: Wear Monitoring Measurement Maintenance Plans/Counters
entry.content:
Hi,

I'm trying to establish a maintenance plan based on a wear measurement reading where I want a WO to generate once the wear measurement hits or passes 180 (daily readings are taken and recording as a counter Measuring Point in SAP).  Readings will continue to be taken, sometimes as high as 225 as the timing of the actual change out can fluctuate depending on operational needs.   

The solution I had come up with was to do a counter change out and zero the counter readings (including the total) at each change out work order, however this is affecting the maintenance plan as (after the initial generation at 180) it is looking for a measurement reading of 360 to trigger the next change out.  Without having to reset the Maintenance Plan at each change out, can I set it to trigger at a reading of 180, rather than 180, 360, 720 etc)?

The reason for zeroing the total counter also is that depending on when the change out is done (i.e. 180 or 195 or 225 or any number in between) the trigger points of 360, 720 etc become increasingly out of alignment when the values being recorded daily.

Or let me know how you would set this up if I've approached it incorrectly.

Thank you.

Is there a way to get a list of data of documents attached to Maintenance Work Orders in SAP Public cloud? 

We would like to gather this information for each Plant if possible

Tried to check on CDS views and tables but can't find one.

entry.title: How to Activate Capacity Availability Check in SAP PM (S/4HANA, SAP GUI)
entry.content:
How to Activate Capacity Availability Check in SAP PM (S/4HANA, SAP GUI)

Purpose of this document

In this blog post, I will guide SAP consultants and senior PM users through the process of enabling and configuring Capacity Availability Check in the Plant Maintenance (PM) module of SAP S/4HANA (SAP GUI).
The aim is to ensure that when maintenance orders are created (e.g., IW31, IW32), the system automatically checks whether the available capacity of the assigned work centers is sufficient and provides alerts or blocks the release when capacity overload occurs.

Prerequisites

Before starting configuration, make sure you have access to:

  • SPRO / SIMG configuration path
  • IR01/IR02 (Work Center creation/change)
  • IW31/IW32/IW33 (Maintenance Orders)
  • OIOI (Material/PRT/Capacity Availability Check Control)
  • OPU7 (Control Parameters for Plant Maintenance Order Scheduling)
  • OIOT (Scheduling Type for Orders)

Step 1: Define Work Center Capacities

Open IR01/IR02 and configure the capacity data for the Work Center.

The formula for Total Available Capacity is:

Operating time Ã— Capacity Utilization Ã— 60 (minutes) Ã— No. of Individual Capacities

Example:

14.70 Ã— 70 Ã— 9 Ã— 60 = 7938 minutes

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

Step 2: Configure Availability Check in OIOI

Path in SPRO:

Plant Maintenance and Customer Service â†’ Maintenance and Service Processing â†’ Maintenance and Service Orders â†’ Functions and Settings for Order Types â†’ Availability Check for Material, PRTs, and Capacities â†’ Define Inspection Control

For each Order Type, configuration must be done twice:

  • Top section: for Material and PRTs
  • Bottom section: for Capacity Availability Check

Recommendation:

  • Use profile SAPPM_G013 (PM: Capacity availability check â‰¥ 3.0D)
  • Uncheck "No check"OIOI

Step 3: Set Scheduling Parameters (OPU7)

Path in SPRO:

Plant Maintenance and Customer Service â†’ Maintenance and Service Processing â†’ Maintenance and Service Orders â†’ Scheduling â†’ Set Scheduling Parameters

Or directly with T-code OPU7.
OPU7

 

 

 

 

 

 

Step 4: Review Scheduling Type (OIOT)

Although preconfigured by default, senior consultants must check Scheduling Type (T-code OIOT).

OIOT

 

 

 

 

 

 

Recommended setting:

  • 3 = Only Capacity Requirements

This ensures that when operations are entered in IW31, the system checks Work Center capacity against requirements.
Alternatively, you can directly set Scheduling Type during order creation in IW31.
IW31-IW32

 

 

 

 

System Behavior in IW31 (Maintenance Order)

When you create a maintenance order (commonly Corrective Maintenance â€“ CM) and enter Operations, the system calculates the required work (Work = Duration Ã— number of persons).

At Release (REL):

  • System checks total load vs. available capacity.
  • If overload occurs, system displays a detailed availability log.
  • If capacity is insufficient, status will be updated as:
    • RELR (Release rejected)
    • MSCP (Capacity Shortage)

This ensures that planners are immediately notified when capacity limits are exceeded.

Capacities with Overload

 

Conclusion

Activating Capacity Availability Check in SAP PM is a best practice that helps organizations maintain realistic maintenance planning, avoid resource overload, and ensure efficient use of work centers.

This feature is often underutilized, but once configured, it can bring significant value by enforcing capacity discipline during maintenance order processing.

ðŸ‘‰ I hope this guide helps you implement capacity checks in your PM projects. Feel free to leave your questions in the commentsâ€”I will be happy to answer them.

entry.title: Pasting multiple components in maintenance order component screen
entry.content:
Hello all,

May I know if there's any way to paste multiple components at once in the component screen,

Like copying from spreadsheet like 100 line items from spreadsheet then directly pasting in the component screen,

Or is there any button that needs to be activated via SAP note or Business Function?

PLM Enterprise Asset Management (EAM)/Plant Maintenance (PM)

entry.title: Offset days calculation for Performance based Maintenance Plan
entry.content:
Hi Team,

We have created and scheduled a performance based maintenance plan. We have entered

Annual Estimate = 1000, Cycle = 72, Last Counter Reading = 150

When we scheduled the maintenance plan we get offset days as 26. Can you please help me understand how the offset days are calculated?

We have not entered any offset value

Regards,

Jaya

entry.content: Is there a specific GGB1 substitution area/callup point for operation level data for maintenance work orders with OLC activated? If not,  where is the most suitable enhancement/user exit to perform substitution for operation level data? Thank you.

How this can be linked with S4 Equipment and respective location details

Can someone help how this can be achieved?

Dave

entry.title: Offset and Next PlanCounterReading Calculation
entry.content:
Hi Team,

We have maintenance plan with Cycle = 4000 , Annual Estimate  = 8000, Last Counter reading = 66662. Now Offset to PlanCounterReading is taken as 2000 instead of 4000 and next PlancounterReading is 68662. Shouldn't it be 70662? From where 2000 is coming into the picture?

Regards,

Jaya

entry.title: Access Restriction based on maintenance order type
entry.content:
Hi All, 

My client wants to grant create/change access for corrective, breakdown maintenance order type to supervisor however in case of preventive maintenance order type, they want to give only display access , not create /change access . Is it feasible to accomplish this requirement through standard SAP S4 Hana ( Private Cloud ) without any customization ? Please suggest .

Thank you .

Mohammed

entry.title: Restricting TECO of maintenance order when there is open PO
entry.content:
Hi All, 

I am currently working in SAP S4 Hana Private Cloud version . I am able to perform TECO & business closure of maintenance order when there is open PO ( GR/SES is not done ) . Is there any standard configuration settings available to restrict to perform TECO and Business Closure when there is open PO ? Please shed some light on this .

Thanking you 

Best Regards

entry.title: Dependencies in task list
entry.content:
Good afternoon,

My client is asking to create a query / or find a transaction (GUI or Fiori) to have visible in a task list which operations have dependencies. 
So he wants to enter 'MASTERTL' and see in a report the dependencies as shown in the picture per activity.

Currently working on a generic task list with 2000++ operations and key user wants to know for which operations the dependencies are missing.

entry.title: Request for Option to Create Single PM Notification for Multiple Equipment
entry.content:
We are currently unable to create a single PM Notification for multiple equipment at a time in SAP. During the notification creation process, there is no option available to enter or select multiple equipment.
Our requirement is to create one notification that covers multiple equipment, instead of generating separate notifications for each.

Is there a standard process or configuration in SAP that allows this functionality?
If not available in standard SAP, is there any customized solution or enhancement that can be implemented to meet this requirement?

Looking forward to your guidance on this.

 


------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Learn more about the SAP Support user and program here.

entry.content:

Regards,

Jaya

entry.title: Planning plant not populated automatically when assigning revision code to work orders IW38/IW37N
entry.content:
Hi, this question was asked by another user several years ago but a solution was not provided.

When assigning a revision code to one or multiple work orders in IW38 (or IW37N) using menu option Order > Revision > Assign revision, the planning plant is not populated automatically. I tried the parameter ID IWK in the user profile but this does not work. I only work in one plant so having this automatically populated in the assign revision screen would save unnecessary clicks and data entry.

entry.title: How-To change the thumbnail image within the Maintenance Order details when using Fiori App F2175
entry.content: When opening the Maintenance Order details directly from Fiori App F2175, there is a default image (of a hard hat) displayed. How can this be changed to a different image?

entry.title: SAP CS to S4HANA Service - End of Usage Right vs. Display Transactions in 2030+
entry.content:
SAP brought SAP CS as Compatibility Pack to S4HANA and informed in notes 2962632 and 2269324 that the product is discontinued with SAP S4HANA Service as successor as well as usage rights ends by 31/12/30.

Furthermore, there's a nice blog article describing what happens and how to move on.
A crucial topic ("Can documents and transactional data in Compatibility Scope still be displayed and can open business processes be finished?") is handled in chapter 8: can I access in read mode to my legacy data.

Though there's a general statement (I conclude reading access might still be possible since PM functionality will stay), it's referencing to the related Business Impact Note. As per "S4HANA CompScope - Way Forward - Info" Excel sheet, the respective note is again 2962632. There's no statement for the read-possibilities.

Is there any official statement confirming there is still read access to CS Service Orders/Notification beyond 2030 (without need to extract data to 3rd party solutions or pull the data in customer specific reports)?

 

Thank you very much!
